experience: You and Kim both know Dimitri Ponomareff, Erika Flora PMP, PgMP, ITIL Expert,PRINCE2,CSP, and 42 others
I lost out on $100,000 last week.
We had a powerful Hollywood celebrity approach us.
The meeting took place at our office.
And he brought his business partner.
I explained that the app needed validation first.
“It’s time sensitive. We need it now.”
We explained that app development is a process much like building a house.
You create a blueprint and specs - then you start building.
They replied, “How long will this take?”
I explained, “We’re not rented mules. App development takes collaboration.”
“I don’t want to learn about your process. I want an app.”
“It looks like we won’t be working together”
In one meeting, we tossed out a $100K opportunity.
It’s easy to be impressed by famous people.
As your business scales, so do your clients.
But your values should never change
At the end of the day, it’s your reputation on the line.
If you don’t push back for what you believe in, then you’ll fall for everything.
I could see my earlier self taking a deal like this one.
But today, I’m a war veteran.
Rome didn’t get built in a day.
Don’t expect it to be different for a billion-dollar idea.

We're hiring! We are adding a Network Engineering Manager to our Managed Services team. This person will lead a team of talented engineers, constantly look for areas of improvement, construct plans for implementation, and drive the execution of these plans to completion. Get the details and apply online today. https://hubs.ly/H08XRvb0
Manage ~150 NetApps (~6PB), EMC VMAX/DMX, HP and IBM storage, and SAN fabric across the southwest.
Manage/administer ~50 NetApp filers for ~20,000 users and ~260TB of data.
Build, maintain and troubleshoot Windows servers (2K8, 2K3, 2K) in an enterprise environment.
Led teams up to 15 people to provide exceptional support and customer service to our customers by challenging, nurturing, and motivating my team mates.
recommendations: Patricia Stedman
Experienced ITIL Certified IT manager with 19 years in the industry.
July 10, 2011, Kim was senior to Patricia but didn’t manage directly

Kim was an excellent coworker at ProNet Solutions. She ran her team with efficiency, and was ground breaking in her management style. She is an asset to any corporate IT department, and when her leadership skills are leveraged she is unsurpassed. I would enjoy working with and for Kim again in the future.

summary: I've been in IT for 17 years and used to be a jack-of-all-trades until I got into storage. Desktop, printer, server, app, backups, Jr. DBA, VMWare, you name it.Besides being a self-proclaimed geek, I'm a writer, business owner, and a music freak.
